channel.title: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please
channel.description:
Well as you know there is a mod abuse thread out right now. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,132961.0.html and it think we should really recognize the mods for everything good they do for us today:
[ul][li]Keep Too much Spam from happening[/li] [li]Keep scammers, and other people who try to give viruses and other bad things that could harm us [/li] [li]Help with things on our RS2 servers. [/li] [li] Makes sure this community stays stable (Keeps useless things out)[/li] [li]Respects others, when they respect them.[/li] [li] Helpful to new players[/li][/ul]
Mods do also much more things then just this.
So basically what I'm trying to get at is. Mods arn't bad like the other thread is speaking of.
They arn't just helping people today they have helped people on this site seince it has been created!
Note: Don't lock please.
Please leave feedback also!

item.title: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please
item.dc:creator: @mod_robby mod robby
item.description:
@mod_robby wrote:

[quote=“Angel of grim, post:20, topic:91202”]It’s what it said on the error page.[/quote]for some reason that is very hard to beleive because the worst i think a mod on mopar forums would do to someone who mislead links is confront them with their problem or give a warning at worst

Read full topic

item.title: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Zenzie:

Unnamed gave me 1month mute for blurring out a bad word …

Well I don’t know the story behind that, but I’m sure there is much more behind it then that.

You may already have had a warning, or you may have continually flamed, etc.

Read full topic

0h ok

item.source: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please

item.title: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

soadfreek409:

Just today? We’re recognizing the past too… I know mods are helpful, but mods are supposed to do more then those 5 bullets you posted… Helping beginners is a big one to me… I see people blow them off telling them they’re idiots and you do nothing then the thread get locked because it was a new player asking for help… It’s sad to think mods do that… lol

Of course we are supposed to help, but try to see this:

Many questions get asked like “how do i make a server?” Well, if they would read the stickies in the tutorial section they would know right away. I always refer people to there. However I will not spoon feed them.

It’s a little ridiculous though. I mean people start going on these flaming and spamming frenzies and then when they get banned they wonder why.

The creator of http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,132961.0.html was banned for mass flaming before, after continual warnings. Then he made a new account and mass spammed saying stuff like “lyke pmg i r hax ur forums cuz u ban me!!!1111oneone.” So then when he gets banned we are all of a sudden power abusers?

Get real guys.

Read full topic
item.source: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please

I Dont agree.

[quote]Unnamed gave me 1month mute for blurring out a bad word …

That true? I really fail to see why thats bad.[/quote]

If that is true i soppose then can be extreme at times but they have to manage a lot of people.

item.title: How mods are helpful and make the community stable[read] Please
item.dc:creator: @Surfingpikachao Surfingpikachao
item.description:
@Surfingpikachao wrote:

[quote]As a non-supporter yo.. That post wasn't a praise lol.[/quote]

oh… i just noticed that…

O I c wut u did thar!

On topic: yes I support because Mods have helped me tons of times and you can’t be horrible to them because one person got banned or something. The mods on this forum are outstanding and don’t deserve to get treated like crap after all the work they’ve put into this forum. Sorry “modsarecrapandsmell” guys - YOU LOSE. lawlomgwtflolroflmfaobbqsauce.

Read full topic
